oai_dc:dc.dc:title: Two pilots about to leave on a mission, 1944
oai_dc:dc.dc:description: A photograph of two pilots, Richard "Bulgey" Dotterer (left) and Clarence E. Louden, during World War II. This photograph was later used in a tape for national broadcast that set out to show the everyday life of men serving in the war. Dotterer stayed in the service, and went on to fight in the Korean War. Louden was known for always carrying maps with him. He returned home to Pennsylvania after World War II. Forms part of the Veterans History Project collection. 1 photograph negative: b & w ; 120 mm.
oai_dc:dc.dc:subject: Dotterer, Richard T.; Loudon, Clarence E.
United States. Army Air Forces. Tactical Reconnaissance Squadron, 109th; United States. Army Air Forces. Air Force, 9th
